User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the restaurant staff management system.

id.description: Unique identifier for the User entity. This corresponds to the Firebase Firestore document ID.

name.description: The user's name. Must be unique across all users.

role.description: The user's role within the system.  Allowed values: 'admin', 'waiter', 'payment'.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the user was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the user was last updated.

createdBy.description: UID of the user who created this user.

updatedBy.description: UID of the user who last updated this user.

type.description: Type of the room (e.g., Single, Double, Suite).

MenuItem.title: Menu Item
MenuItem.description: Represents an item on the restaurant menu.

stockType.description: The type of stock management for the item.

stock.description: The current stock level for the item, if applicable.

Table.title: Table
Table.description: Represents a table in the restaurant.

section.description: Section of the restaurant where the table is located.

capacity.description: Number of people the table can accommodate.

Order.title: Order
Order.description: Represents a customer's order for a specific table.

tableId.description: ID of the table this order belongs to.

totalPrice.description: The total price of the order.

OrderItem.title: Order Item
OrderItem.description: Represents a single item within an order.

orderId.description: ID of the order this item belongs to.

name.description: Name of the menu item at the time of order.

price.description: Price of the menu item at the time of order.

Bill.title: Bill
Bill.description: Represents a finalized bill for an order, including discounts and totals.

orderId.description: The ID of the corresponding order.

status.description: The payment status of the bill.

subtotal.description: The total price of all items before discount.

discount.description: The discount percentage applied to the bill (0-100).

total.description: The final amount to be paid after discount.

paidAt.description: Timestamp when the bill was paid.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to support a restaurant staff management system with role-based access control.  It emphasizes simplicity and security, especially concerning user data.

The core design revolves around storing user data in a dedicated collection, `/users/{userId}`, with `{userId}` corresponding to the Firebase Authentication `uid`. This structure ensures path-based ownership, making security rules straightforward and efficient. No denormalization is needed as only the authenticated user (or an admin via separate, potentially centralized admin data) should have access to user profiles, supporting the required QAPs through structural segregation.

This approach avoids `get()` calls in security rules, promoting Authorization Independence. It also inherently supports listing users securely, as only an admin (determined by a separate `/roles_admin/{uid}` document) would have list access to the `/users` collection, while regular users can only access their own document at `/users/{uid}`. Roles are explicitly defined in the user document, allowing for content-based authorization checks within the security rules (e.g., `request.resource.data.role == 'admin'`).

To support the 'no duplicate' constraint on the 'name' field, consider using a Cloud Function triggered on document creation or update. This function can query the collection to check for existing names and reject the write if a duplicate is found, ensuring data integrity.
